Implement captions and alt text in alternative workflows

Source: vignettes/caps-alttext-alt-workflows.Rmd
caps-alttext-alt-workflows.Rmd

Purpose

We’ve designed asar so that our recommended workflow automatically adds captions and alternative text for tables and figures into reports. But what if your report has been generated with another kind of workflow? For example, what if you’ve created tables and/or figures without stockplotr? Or have customized your skeleton with other features that have impacted your tables and figures?

The purpose of this vignette is to explain how to ensure that your alt text and captions appear in your report, even when using an altered workflow.

This vignette will be updated as we encounter more varieties of customized workflows.

When you’ve created plots without stockplotr

As explained in the stockplotr “How captions and alternative text are generated” tutorial, exporting at least one figure or table will produce a ‘captions_alt_text_template.csv’ file, which contains the templates for each table or figure’s caption/alternative text.

  • If you’ve created all of your tables and figures without stockplotr, then you will not have a version of this csv at all. Navigate to the Create new template file section.

  • If you’ve created at least one table/figure without stockplotr, then you will have a version of this csv, but you will be missing the caption/alt text for the plots made without stockplotr. Navigate to the Add to existing template file section.

Create new template file

You will need to create a csv containing your plots’ captions and alternative text. Follow the steps in the “Write captions and alternative text” section of the “Adding Custom Tables and Figures” vignette for instructions. Stop when you reach the “Export your custom tables and figures” section.

Add to existing template file

Follow the instructions in the Create new template file section, with one exception: you do not have to create a new ‘captions_alt_text_template.csv’ file. Simply add to your existing file.

Developed by Samantha Schiano, Sophie Breitbart, Steve Saul.
